intro: Pseudo-fumaria intermedia, commonly known as the false fumaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in loose racemes, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
